body:
First, the code in class GcsDnsCache is not compilable on Windows, changes are needed. We may turn it on later, in another commit.
Second, I don't know why it is important.  Windows has a builtin DNS cache.  It's also true for Fedora, which runs a local "dnsmasq" for that.  Why do we need an extra cache layer in tensorflow? Is it just for the ones who do not have a local DNS cache?
body_html:
First, the code in class GcsDnsCache is not compilable on Windows, changes are needed. We may turn it on later, in another commit.
Second, I don't know why it is important. Windows has a builtin DNS cache. It's also true for Fedora, which runs a local "dnsmasq" for that. Why do we need an extra cache layer in tensorflow? Is it just for the ones who do not have a local DNS cache?
body_text:
First, the code in class GcsDnsCache is not compilable on Windows, changes are needed. We may turn it on later, in another commit.
Second, I don't know why it is important.  Windows has a builtin DNS cache.  It's also true for Fedora, which runs a local "dnsmasq" for that.  Why do we need an extra cache layer in tensorflow? Is it just for the ones who do not have a local DNS cache?
